casebody.data:
[*] THE GOVERNOR against Sundry SURETIES on Adm’n bond. A non-resident prosecutor of an administration bond, shall give surety for costs, if required. Ewing, for the defendants,

moved for a rule to stay proceedings in this cause until surety was filed for costs, on an affidavit that the person whose name was indorsed on the writ as prosecutor, was not a resident.

Wall, contra.

The court will not take notice of the name indorsed on the Avrit.

By the Court.

The person whose name is indorsed on the Avrit, is substantially the plaintiff; take your rule.

Rule alloAved.
